title.narrative: Contribute to strengthen the capacities of resilience of communities in crisis

description.narrative: The EiE project aims to contribute to inclusive and equitable quality education, including life skills for all boys and girls in Mali; particularly the conflict -affected areas of northern Mali. From 1991, the advent of democracy to 2012 Mali was cited as a model in the sub -region and even on the continent. With the multidimensional crisis of 2012, the country is faced with a destabilization of its security, which has had an impact on the normal functioning of the regulatory structures of public life. Added to this is the global health crisis that is the COVID19 pandemic which affects all sectors of the country's economic and social life. The overall objective of this project is to contribute to inclusive and equitable quality education, including life skills, for all boys and girls in Mali, particularly in areas affected by the conflict in Northern Mali. Under the terms of this project, the following results are achieved: Improved quality of education (such as conflict sensitivity, child -centered learning approach, and protection) in 20 public schools or 3095 children (48% girls, 52% boys) identified in the Bourem cercle, Improve access to quality education for out -of -school girls and boys through the bridging approach (160 girls and boys (50% girls, 50% boys) in accelerated classes), 20 schools (16 in Bourem and 4 in Taboye) have put in place prevention measures and mechanisms, 20 AMEs (16 in Bourem and 4 in Taboye) have conducted awareness -raising activities. The targets are 80 teachers, principals and school supervisors (M/F) were strengthened to provide quality education based on conflict -sensitive and child -centered learning approaches, positive discipline and psychosocial support, 114 school teachers and community resource persons have been trained to provide psychosocial support to children and to promote child protection and an inclusive, violence -free learning environment for learners (boys and girls).
